intro: Galium aparinella, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are small, dry capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Galium aparinella is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
